question: What comes next in the sequence: 1, 11, 21, 1211, 111221?
If a rooster lays an egg on top of a barn roof, which way does it roll?
I am taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost every person. What am I?
Which word is spelled incorrectly in every dictionary?
A man gave one son 10 cents and another son was given twice as much. What time is it?
answer: Time to get a new watch.

question: What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with the wind. What am I?
What has keys but can't open locks?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you don't have me. What am I?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
What has keys but can't open locks, and can sing but never talks?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What has keys but can't open locks, and comes in a square box?
What begins and has no end, and is the key to all life?
What has an endless supply of letters but starts empty?
I am not alive, but I can grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What has keys but can't open locks and can sing but not talk?
How can you arrange four 9's to make 100?
You see a boat filled with people. It has not sunk, but when you look again you donâ€™t see a single person on the boat. Why?
answer: All the people were married, so there's not a single person on the boat.
